title: 108_s2193
content: The "Small Business Loan Revitalization Act" may be cited as the short title. Combination financing is addressed in the Act. The Small Business Loan Revitalization Act introduces combination financing, which involves a guaranteed loan under the Small Business Act and a commercial loan, with the guarantee approved within 120 days of obtaining the commercial loan. The Small Business Loan Revitalization Act allows small businesses to receive combination financing, which includes a guaranteed loan under the Small Business Act and a commercial loan not exceeding $2,000,000. The commercial loan can be obtained from the same lender or a different one, secured by a senior lien, and must comply with specific provisions. The Small Business Loan Revitalization Act allows small businesses to receive combination financing, including a guaranteed loan under the Small Business Act and a commercial loan. The commercial loan fee is 0.5 percent of the loan amount, paid by the lender to the Administration if the loan has a senior credit position. Proceeds from the guaranteed loan must offset the Administration's cost of guaranteeing loans. The Small Business Loan Revitalization Act allows small businesses to receive combination financing up to $4,000,000. The net amount of the deferred participation share cannot exceed the maximum net guarantee provided. Loans guaranteed under this act may be secured by a subordinated lien, and combination financing is available without any loan limitation imposed by the Administration. The Small Business Loan Revitalization Act allows small businesses to receive combination financing up to $4,000,000, with the amendment taking effect upon enactment and being repealed on October 1, 2004. SEC. 3. LOAN GUARANTEE FEES. SEC. 3. LOAN GUARANTEE FEES. Section 7(a) of the Small Business Act is amended to exempt certain loans approved between a specific period from a subparagraph and to adjust the annual fee percentage for guaranteed loans. The annual fee for guaranteed loans is adjusted based on the outstanding balance of the deferred participation share of the loan, with different percentages applying to loans approved during specific periods. The annual fee for guaranteed loans is adjusted based on the outstanding balance of the deferred participation share of the loan, with different percentages applying to loans approved during specific periods. The fee assessed and collected under clause (i) will be 0.35 percent of the outstanding balance of the deferred participation share of the loan until September 30, 2004. The amendments made by subsection (a) will take effect after the date of enactment of this Act and will be repealed on October 1, 2004. SEC. 4. RECONSIDERATION OF LOAN APPLICATIONS REJECTED BASED ON LOAN AMOUNT. Beginning on the first day after the date of enactment of this Act, the Small Business Administration will reconsider loan applications submitted between December 23, 2003, and January 8, 2004, under section 7(a) of the Small Business Act that were rejected based on the loan amount requested. Small businesses that received financing before January 1, 2004, under section 7(a)(14) of the Small Business Act and request a renewal will have their request approved regardless of the size of financing if eligible. The Small Business Administration will allow loans under section 7 of the Small Business Act up to the maximum amount permitted, if the small business is eligible for financing.
